Performances > October 1969: The Twenty-Four Dutiful Sons

October 1969: The Twenty-Four Dutiful Sons

Plays:

The Twenty-Four Dutiful Sons (本朝廿四孝)

Scenes:

Grand Hall in Ashikaga Mansion (足利館大広間)

The Innermost Room (足利館奥御殿)

The Suwa Shrine (諏訪明神百度石)

Kikyo Field (桔梗原)

Kagekatsu and Wooden Clogs (景勝下駄)

Kansuke's House (勘助住家)

Shingen's Mansion (武田信玄館)

Messenger Yoshikiyo's Visit (村上義清上使)

Katsuyori Kills Himself (勝頼切腹)

Shingen's Talk (信玄物語)

The Drug Peddlers' Journey (道行似合の女夫丸)

Bewitched by a Fox (和田別所化性屋敷)

Messenger Kagekatsu's Visit (See also Kenshin's Mansion) (景勝上使 (See also 謙信館）)

The Delivery of the Rifle (See also Kenshin's Mansion) (鉄砲渡し (See also 謙信館))

Kenshin's Mansion (See also Messenger Kagekatsu's Visit and the Delivery of the Rifle) (謙信館 (see akso 景勝上使 and 鉄砲渡し))

The Death of Dosan (道三最期)

Characters:

Nureginu (腰元濡衣)

Lady Tokiwai (奥方常盤井)

Yoshikiyo Murakami (村上義清)

Blind Katsuyori (盲勝頼)

Hyobu Itagaki (板垣兵部)

Minosaku, in fact Takeda Katsuyori (簑作実は武田勝頼)

Shingen Takeda (武田信玄)

Kakusuke, a servant (奴角助)

Hakibeii (Hakubei), a servant (奴掃兵衛)

Sekibei, in fact Dosan (花守関兵衛実は斎藤道三)

Kenshin Nagao (長尾謙信)

Kagekatsu Nagao (長尾景勝)

Yaegaki (八重垣姫)

Rokuro (白須賀六郎)

Kobunji (原小文治)

Kansuke (山本勘助)

Yoshiharu, the Shogun (将軍義晴)

Lady Taoyame, Shogun's wife (手弱女御前)

Ujitoki Hojo (北条氏時)

Yamashironosuke (直江山城之助)

Yatsuhashi (腰元八つ橋)

Shizunokata, Shogun's mistress (愛妾賤の方)

Shinzaemon Inoue, in fact Dosan Saito (井上新左衛門 実は 斉藤道三)

Heinai Yokota (横田兵内)

Toma Ochiai (落合藤馬)

Karaori, Kosaka (Takasaka)'s wife (高坂妻唐織)

Irie, Koshina's wife (越名妻入江)

Jihizo, in fact Yamashironosuke (慈悲蔵 実は 直江山城之助)

Danjo Tokitsuna Kosaka (高坂弾正)

Danjo Tadamasa Koshina (越名弾正)

Otane, in fact Yatsuhashi (お種 実は 腰元八つ橋)

Kansuke's widow (Kansuke II's mother, Koshiji) (勘助の母 (母越路))

Yokozo, Kansuke Yamamoto II (横蔵 後に 山本勘助)

Minematsu (伜峰松)

Shogoro, a farmer (百姓正五郎)

Tosuke, a farmer (百姓戸助)

Gunta Iiyama (飯山軍太)

Gonroku, a carter (車遣い権六)

Kampachi, a carter (車遣い勘八)

Kusuke, a rogue (車遣い九介(助))

Dosan Saito (斎藤道三)

Servants (奴)

Jirokichi (次郎吉)

Maid servants (腰元)

Soldiers (雑兵)
